channel.title: The New York Times Magazine
channel.description: Features, columns, essays and photography from The New York Times Magazine.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2016 The New York Times Company

item.title: Are Get-Out-the-Vote Efforts Targeting Latinos Working?
item.description: An effort in Florida is trying out a new theory — and laying the groundwork for what might come next.
item.author: By EMILY BAZELON

item.title: Judge John Hodgman on Seeking Damages for Half Cups of Coffee
item.author: By JOHN HODGMAN

item.title: How to Busk
item.description: Make sure the spot feels right. Start with a couple of dollars in the bucket.
item.author: By JAIME LOWE

item.title: An American in a Strange Land
item.description: After more than a decade away, a foreign correspondent comes back to take stock of his divided homeland.
item.author: By JIM YARDLEY

item.title: The Striking Humanity of ‘Moonlight’
item.description: A.O. Scott joins to talk about the coming-of-age film. We also discuss Solange’s “A Seat at the Table” and how to unwind.
item.author: By WESLEY MORRIS and JENNA WORTHAM

item.title: Want to Know What Virtual Reality Might Become? Look to the Past
item.description: Nineteenth-century diversions could offer some clues about the medium’s potential.
item.author: By STEVEN JOHNSON

item.title: The Healing Powers of Laughter Yoga
item.description: Two decades ago, in a land of sensory overload and spiritual abundance, a doctor mixed together meditation and hilarity.
item.author: Photographs by ALEC SOTH

item.title: Letter of Recommendation: ‘Pinky and the Brain’
item.description: It’s typically insulting to call a show formulaic, but sometimes the genius is the formula.
item.author: By JONAH WEINER
